result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L Chipman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If defendant can provide proof of payment of the restitution, court will consider the restitution paid.

Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Defendant is not to possess any checks and if she does, then needs to reconcile every month with her agent.

Order / Judgment For Court Ordered Financial Obligations (waive court costs, restitution paid in full)
and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction Probation Cases (waive court costs as restitution has been paid in full)
and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases - extends probation for 12 months or until paid in full
Defendant via video and Agent Katie Suwyn via video

9:38 a.m. Defendant present in court via video without counsel.  Agent Katie Suwyn present in court via video. Court questions defendant regarding payments. Statement by Agent Suwyn, made payment in April and then last week. Statement by defendant - should be able to pay off before the discharge date. Statement by Agent Suwyn - confirms defendant made large payments and was paying faithfully. Defendant believes she will have all restitution paid off by discharge date.  Court will waive the court costs if ALL restuitution is paid in full. Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year. Statement by Agent - defendant only owes restitution on 2017CF15, all restitution is paid on 2016CM129.

Court adjourned at 9:43 a.m.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely

Defendant called to inform us that she is in Baker Montana for work until November 11th and will not be back before that time.  Defendant hopes to have this all paid before her discharge date in October. Informed defendant that we still need to hold the PRH. Defendant works pm's and nights and would be able to appear via zoom. Zoom instructions will be provided to the agent to get to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
9:45 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Matt Goldin.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Goldin - have a plea questionnaire to file with the court.  Atty Goldin recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 and count 3 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2.  Court orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA - restitution has been paid.  Statement by Betsy Amend - Treasurer, does not show restitution paid.  Sentencing statement by Atty Goldin.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNTS 1 & 2
SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS (EACH COUNT):

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $449.39.  Further statement by the court - If defendant can provide proof of payment of the restitution, court will consider the restitution paid.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is not to possess any checks and if she does, then needs to reconcile every month with her agent.

 Court adjourned at 9:56 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.

11:40 am.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Goldin - had contact with the defendant and expect a resolution.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on October 24, 2016 at 9:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:41 a.m.
State's
